predicate.note: Frames file for 'patch' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus.

roleset.name: to mend or supply with a patch

example.name: transitive
example.text: Although the union-bidder expects [*-1] to patch together a substitute offer , consisting of less cash , the failure [*] to get cash from Japanese and American banks confirmed a growing fear [*ICH*-2] among arbitragers that the pageant of high-leverage takeover deals is ending .
example.arg: a substitute offer , consisting of less cash ,

roleset.name: to mend or supply with a patch

example.name: intransitive
example.text: The arbs may recoup some of their paper losses if the UAL deal gets patched up again , as they did in 1982 when Occidental Petroleum Co. rescued them with a $ 4 billion [*U*] takeover of Cities Service [*T*-1] .
